greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of set partitions of [2n] where each subset is again partitioned into n nonempty subsets.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..345
maple: b:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(b(n-j, k)
mathematica: b[n_, k_] := b[n, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[k == 0 || k > n, 0, Sum[b[n-j, k]* Binomial[n - 1, j - 1] StirlingS2[j, k], {j, k, n}]]];
a /@ Range[0, 18] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 05 2020, after Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 02 2019
